greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest solution to 10^m == 1 (mod m) having the prime divisor A066364(n).
link: Ray Chandler, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2060 (first 501 terms from Max Alekseyev)
formula: a(n)=m(p), where p=A066364(n) and m(p)=lcm(p, ord_p(10), m(q)) with q going over all prime divisors of ord_p(10).
example: a(6)=m(5477)=22494039 since it is the smallest m such that 10^m == 1 (mod m) and 5477|m.
program: (PARI) { m(p) = my(f,l,q); f=factorint(p)[,1]; l=p; for(i=1,length(f),q=znorder(Mod(10,f[i])); l=lcm(l,q); l=lcm(l,m(q)) ); l }
results.author: _Max Alekseyev_, Nov 17 2005
